title: 10 Best Percale Sheets in 2025, Tested and Reviewed by AD
description: These high-end finds are perfect for warm days and cool nights
author: Nora Taylor, Nashia Baker
excerpt: These are the best percale sheets our editors say are reminiscent of luxury hotel bedding. Shop our favorites from Quince, Petite Plume, Matouk, and more
text: Featured in this articleBest OverallQuince Classic Organic Percale Sheet SetRead moreFor Traditional BedroomsPetite Plume Luxe Premium Cotton Bed SheetsRead moreThe Splurge SetMatouk Bergamo Egyptian Cotton SheetingRead moreOut of all of the linens in the world, the best percale sheets are some of our favorites thanks to their combo of cooling comfort and a crisp feel. Percale is cotton (though always double-check the labels) and refers to the weave, which is strong and tight because of the basket pattern—one over, one under—hence why the sheets have a matte finish as opposed to shiny.A close cousin to sateen, a percale bedding set—including pillowcases and all—aren’t super glossy, pill less than other options, and can’t be beat when it comes to a high-end look and feel. They are often likened to a well-pressed dress shirt. This high-quality bedding will get softer with each wash (just be sure to follow the care instructions and you won’t have to worry about shrinkage) so your bedding situation will only develop more of a lived-in feel over time. The world is your percale oyster, and we’re here to help guide you toward the best sheets for you. Senior commerce editor Nashia Baker dresses her mattress with these and is a fan of their design and breathable feel. “I usually stick with sheets in solid colors, but the timeless toile print caught my eye and evoked an elegant aesthetic I wanted to try for my sleep setup,” she says. “The botanical print is like something out of a painting and has shown no signs of fading.” Between humid days and cold nights, Baker adds that the fabric is smooth to the touch and keeps her comfortable amid the ever-changing New York City weather.The Splurge SetMatouk Bergamo Egyptian Cotton SheetingLightweightStructured look and feelDozens of colorwaysAll bedding is sold separatelyMaterial: Giza 87 and 92 Egyptian cotton yarnsThread count: Near-500 thread countSizes: Full, queen, king, California kingColors: 43Fitted-sheet depth: N/ACertifications: N/AThis is a splurge, we know. But if you are looking for higher thread count options (we’re talking 500-plus) look no further. These sheets fully won contributor Allie Weiss over with their hotel-level luxury. “I hate scratchy sheets, and breathed a sigh of relief when I slipped into these. They are both lightweight, crisp-looking, and soft to the touch—talk about a win-win,” she says. I love the fact that it’s made of organic cotton (and also Oeko-Tex certified),” she says. Coming in at under $60, the sheet set is available in more than 20 colors, including charcoal, dusty rose, silver, navy, white, and lilac.For MinimalistsSaatva Organic Percale Sheet SetDeep pocketsIdeal for an understated bedroomMaterial: Long-staple cottonThread count: 200Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king, split kingColors: 6Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inchesCertifications: OEKO-TEX Standard 100 certified“Of all the sheets I’ve tried, these cotton percale sheets feel the most like expensive hotel sheets that I’ve come across, and the price tag certainly reflects that!” hard to beat a review like that, especially from our commerce director Rachel Fletcher, who tests a lot of bedding. These are made from long staple cotton that just gets softer with each wash.Best for Pattern VarietyPhoto: Yelena Moroz AlpertPhoto: Yelena Moroz AlpertBrooklinen Classic Percale Core Sheet SetSmoothTight weaveApproachable patterns and colorsSeasonal designs sell out fastMaterial: 100% long-staple cottonSizes: 270 thread countColors: 23Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inchesCertifications: OEKO-TEX certified for chemical safetyContributor Yelena Moroz Alpert uses these long-staple cotton sheets for her bed and loves the seasonal colors and prints. “It definitely wakes up my bedding collection which is mostly solid colors, with a few florals and stripes,” she says, adding that she owns the oyster option. “In fact, my husband is really on board with it because he likes the print and is happy not to sleep in a bed of flowers. (He thinks all floral sheets look like a shower curtain.) The more neutral oyster in ‘pebble’ looks really good too and will pair with pretty much any duvet cover I have.” Aside from the design, Alpert is also a fan of the sturdy material. As someone who has tested supima cotton that tends to micro-crease, she says the sheets stay pretty smooth out of the dryer. “The long-staple cotton is more durable than typical cotton, and I can tell that these are woven tightly,” she adds. “I don’t see a way to snag it easily or mess it up in the washing machine.”Serena & Lily Hydrangea Percale Sheet SetMaterial: 100% cotton percaleThread count: 310Sizes: Queen, kingColors: 1Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inchesCertifications: STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX CertifiedOur favorite destination for coastal bedding, these floral percale sheets from Serena & Lily lend an elegant, botanical feel to your bedroom thanks to their soothing blue hue and breathable materials. The petite hydrangea print is an especially fetching choice for spring and summer.Boll & Branch Percale Hemmed Sheet SetMaterial: 100% organic cottonThread count: N/ASizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, king with standard pillowcases, California king, split kingColors: 21Fitted-sheet depth: 17 inchesCertifications: GOTS Certified Organic Cotton, STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEXMade of long-staple cotton, the Boll & Branch site says the sheets look “smooth and structured like a crisp, button-down shirt.” We’re inclined to agree if their tester-favorite hemmed sateen sheets are any indication. The set includes a fitted sheet (that fits mattresses up to 17"), top sheet, and two pillowcases. The bedding is also available in California king sizes and the elusive split king as well. Available in eight soft or neutral colors like ivory and two striped options, there’s something for almost every low-key color preference.The Company Store Classic Cool Cotton Percale Bed Sheet SetMaterial: 100% combed cotton percaleThread count: 300Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California kingColors: 18Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inchesCertifications: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 certificationThese are some of the best cooling sheets on the list. As sheets made for summer, they’re extra breathable and soft thanks to their 100% organic cotton makeup and 200 thread count weave. They come in five on-trend colors with the sort of relaxed wrinkle that offers your bedroom a romantically lived-in look.How We TestedInstead of relying on customer reviews or lab testing, we brought the best percale sheets into our homes to get a real feel for this crisp, breathable bedding throughout the seasons. While they are some of the best cooling sheets you can shop for, they are some of the softest too.Material: Percale sets tend to have a cool feel thanks to their crisp, moisture-wicking fabric. For the utmost quality, we recommend shopping for organic cotton percale sets with certified extra-long staple cotton. A cotton sheet set made of these quality threads is typically less prone to pilling and wear. helps We also kept an eye out for Oeko-Tex certifications to ensure the picks are sustainably made.Pocket depth: To fit a grand mattress, we turn to cotton percale sheets with deep pockets. A good rule of thumb is to search for a fitted sheet with around a 16-inch depth so it can fit over a bed and extras like a mattress topper and protector.Thread count: While some of our picks reach up to 500 thread counts, we opted for organic cotton sheets that leaned towards a minimum of a 200 thread count to promote temperature regulation and comfort. This lower thread count might feel weighty, but it is breathable enough to be one of the top picks for warm weather and hot sleepers.Prices: We also included a range of price point options to fit a variety of budgets, including our favorite budget-friendly Amazon sheets. Many of the sets in our guide also come with extras like a flat sheet and even a matching duvet cover to complete your bedscape.
html:
Featured in this article

Out of all of the linens in the world, the best percale sheets are some of our favorites thanks to their combo of cooling comfort and a crisp feel. Percale is cotton (though always double-check the labels) and refers to the weave, which is strong and tight because of the basket pattern—one over, one under—hence why the sheets have a matte finish as opposed to shiny.

A close cousin to sateen, a percale bedding set—including pillowcases and all—aren’t super glossy, pill less than other options, and can’t be beat when it comes to a high-end look and feel. They are often likened to a well-pressed dress shirt. This high-quality bedding will get softer with each wash (just be sure to follow the care instructions and you won’t have to worry about shrinkage) so your bedding situation will only develop more of a lived-in feel over time. The world is your percale oyster, and we’re here to help guide you toward the best sheets for you. Browse every editor-reviewed and -approved set of sheets below.

For consistency, the picks in our guide reflect queen size percale sets.

Best Overall Percale Sheets

Quince Classic Organic Percale Sheet Set

  • Airy
  • Wrinkle-resistant
  • Soft

Only available in neutral hues

  • Material: 100% organic cotton
  • Thread count: 270 thread count
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king
  • Colors: 3
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX

AD PRO senior editor Mel Studach has tried many percale styles over the years, but vouches that her Quince sheet set skews softer than most. “Being 100% cotton, the set is also nicely breathable,” she says. “And while the crisp, smooth texture is incredibly comfortable for sleeping, I also appreciate that when I make my bed every morning, the sheets maintain their structure sans unsightly wrinkles.”

For Traditional Bedrooms

Petite Plume Luxe Premium Cotton Bed Sheets

  • Distinct patterns available
  • Durable and fade-resistant material

Site doesn’t offer thorough specifications on the sheet sizing and certifications

  • Material: 100% long-staple cotton
  • Thread count: N/A
  • Sizes: Twin, full, queen, king
  • Colors: 3
  • Fitted-sheet depth: N/A
  • Certifications: N/A

If your bedroom style leans traditional, these cotton sheets will bring a classic look to your bedding. Senior commerce editor Nashia Baker dresses her mattress with these and is a fan of their design and breathable feel. “I usually stick with sheets in solid colors, but the timeless toile print caught my eye and evoked an elegant aesthetic I wanted to try for my sleep setup,” she says. “The botanical print is like something out of a painting and has shown no signs of fading.” Between humid days and cold nights, Baker adds that the fabric is smooth to the touch and keeps her comfortable amid the ever-changing New York City weather.

The Splurge Set

Matouk Bergamo Egyptian Cotton Sheeting

  • Lightweight
  • Structured look and feel
  • Dozens of colorways

All bedding is sold separately

  • Material: Giza 87 and 92 Egyptian cotton yarns
  • Thread count: Near-500 thread count
  • Sizes: Full, queen, king, California king
  • Colors: 43
  • Fitted-sheet depth: N/A
  • Certifications: N/A

This is a splurge, we know. But if you are looking for higher thread count options (we’re talking 500-plus) look no further. These sheets fully won contributor Allie Weiss over with their hotel-level luxury. “I hate scratchy sheets, and breathed a sigh of relief when I slipped into these. They are both lightweight, crisp-looking, and soft to the touch—talk about a win-win,” she says. This brand also offers a variety of contrasting shams, extra monograms, and even matching duvet covers.

The Budget Pick

Lane Linen Organic Cotton Sheet Set

  • High thread count
  • Deep pockets
  • Often on sale

Some customers note a slightly thin material

  • Material: 100% organic cotton
  • Thread count: 400
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king
  • Colors: 30
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 15 inches
  • Certifications: OEKO-TEX certified 100% Organic Cotton

Another one of our favorite sheet sets on Amazon received high praise from contributor Kristi Kellogg. “If you’re looking for something breathable and cooling, you’ll love this lightweight Lane Linen set. I love the fact that it’s made of organic cotton (and also Oeko-Tex certified),” she says. Coming in at under $60, the sheet set is available in more than 20 colors, including charcoal, dusty rose, silver, navy, white, and lilac.

For Minimalists

Saatva Organic Percale Sheet Set

  • Deep pockets
  • Ideal for an understated bedroom
  • Material: Long-staple cotton
  • Thread count: 200
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king, split king
  • Colors: 6
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: OEKO-TEX Standard 100 certified

“Of all the sheets I’ve tried, these cotton percale sheets feel the most like expensive hotel sheets that I’ve come across, and the price tag certainly reflects that!” hard to beat a review like that, especially from our commerce director Rachel Fletcher, who tests a lot of bedding. These are made from long staple cotton that just gets softer with each wash.

Best for Pattern Variety

  • Photo: Yelena Moroz Alpert

  • Photo: Yelena Moroz Alpert

Brooklinen Classic Percale Core Sheet Set

  • Smooth
  • Tight weave
  • Approachable patterns and colors

Seasonal designs sell out fast

  • Material: 100% long-staple cotton
  • Sizes: 270 thread count
  • Colors: 23
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: OEKO-TEX certified for chemical safety

Contributor Yelena Moroz Alpert uses these long-staple cotton sheets for her bed and loves the seasonal colors and prints. “It definitely wakes up my bedding collection which is mostly solid colors, with a few florals and stripes,” she says, adding that she owns the oyster option. “In fact, my husband is really on board with it because he likes the print and is happy not to sleep in a bed of flowers. (He thinks all floral sheets look like a shower curtain.) The more neutral oyster in ‘pebble’ looks really good too and will pair with pretty much any duvet cover I have.” Aside from the design, Alpert is also a fan of the sturdy material. As someone who has tested supima cotton that tends to micro-crease, she says the sheets stay pretty smooth out of the dryer. “The long-staple cotton is more durable than typical cotton, and I can tell that these are woven tightly,” she adds. “I don’t see a way to snag it easily or mess it up in the washing machine.”

Serena & Lily Hydrangea Percale Sheet Set

  • Material: 100% cotton percale
  • Thread count: 310
  • Sizes: Queen, king
  • Colors: 1
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX Certified

Our favorite destination for coastal bedding, these floral percale sheets from Serena & Lily lend an elegant, botanical feel to your bedroom thanks to their soothing blue hue and breathable materials. The petite hydrangea print is an especially fetching choice for spring and summer.

Boll & Branch Percale Hemmed Sheet Set

  • Material: 100% organic cotton
  • Thread count: N/A
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, king with standard pillowcases, California king, split king
  • Colors: 21
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 17 inches
  • Certifications: GOTS Certified Organic Cotton, STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX

Made of long-staple cotton, the Boll & Branch site says the sheets look “smooth and structured like a crisp, button-down shirt.” We’re inclined to agree if their tester-favorite hemmed sateen sheets are any indication. The set includes a fitted sheet (that fits mattresses up to 17"), top sheet, and two pillowcases. The bedding is also available in California king sizes and the elusive split king as well. Available in eight soft or neutral colors like ivory and two striped options, there’s something for almost every low-key color preference.

The Company Store Classic Cool Cotton Percale Bed Sheet Set

  • Material: 100% combed cotton percale
  • Thread count: 300
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king
  • Colors: 18
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 certification

These are some of the best cooling sheets on the list. With a 300 thread count cotton percale weave backed by a Oeko-Tex certification, these crisp sheets are designed to keep you comfy year-round. Lightweight, smooth, and offered in 18 colors, these are a versatile classic.

Nest Bedding Crinkle Percale Organic Cotton Sheet Set

  • Material: 100% certified organic cotton
  • Thread count: 200
  • Sizes: Twin, twin XL, full, queen, king, California king
  • Colors: 5
  • Fitted-sheet depth: 16 inches
  • Certifications: The brand notes that these sheets are made with certified organic and fair trade certified organic

Nest Bedding has proven to be an AD editor favorite (we love their sateen sheets in particular) and while their snuggle-worthy crinkle percale sheets are the relatively new kids on the block, they check all the right boxes. As sheets made for summer, they’re extra breathable and soft thanks to their 100% organic cotton makeup and 200 thread count weave. They come in five on-trend colors with the sort of relaxed wrinkle that offers your bedroom a romantically lived-in look.

How We Tested

Instead of relying on customer reviews or lab testing, we brought the best percale sheets into our homes to get a real feel for this crisp, breathable bedding throughout the seasons. While they are some of the best cooling sheets you can shop for, they are some of the softest too.

Material: Percale sets tend to have a cool feel thanks to their crisp, moisture-wicking fabric. For the utmost quality, we recommend shopping for organic cotton percale sets with certified extra-long staple cotton. A cotton sheet set made of these quality threads is typically less prone to pilling and wear. helps We also kept an eye out for Oeko-Tex certifications to ensure the picks are sustainably made.

Pocket depth: To fit a grand mattress, we turn to cotton percale sheets with deep pockets. A good rule of thumb is to search for a fitted sheet with around a 16-inch depth so it can fit over a bed and extras like a mattress topper and protector.

Thread count: While some of our picks reach up to 500 thread counts, we opted for organic cotton sheets that leaned towards a minimum of a 200 thread count to promote temperature regulation and comfort. This lower thread count might feel weighty, but it is breathable enough to be one of the top picks for warm weather and hot sleepers.

Prices: We also included a range of price point options to fit a variety of budgets, including our favorite budget-friendly Amazon sheets. Many of the sets in our guide also come with extras like a flat sheet and even a matching duvet cover to complete your bedscape.
